On CARDINAL DATE ORG , in the operative part of its judgment , dismissed as groundless the action introduced by the applicants LAW , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON Dumitru PERSON . The court acknowledged that the plaintiffs were the heirs of PERSON , but considered that they had not proved that the ORG had no title to the seizure . Therefore it held that since the ORG had a valid title , the case came under the provisions of section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , and considered that the sale had been lawfully performed . The court also declared null and void the action introduced by the applicant PERSON ( NORP ) and by PERSON , for lack of signature .
The judgment made no reference to the plaintiff ORG , except to mention him among the plaintiffs who had lodged the action .

CARDINAL . All the applicants appealed . However , the only reasoned appeal was that of the first applicant , who had lodged it in the name of all the plaintiffs , alleging that the seizure had been unlawful , that the sale had been performed in bad faith and that they had claimed that property before the sale .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in the operative part of its judgment , allowed the appeal by all the applicants and varied the LAW first - instance judgment in part by upholding the action lodged by the applicants LAW , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON Dumitru PERSON and by declaring the sale null and void . The court found that the CARDINAL normative acts ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) concerned the granting of orders and medals and the reorganisation of transportation of goods and passengers , therefore the ORG had no valid title to that seizure . It also considered that the then tenants had been in bad faith when they bought that apartment .

It is not mentioned in that judgment whether the applicants PERSON , PERSON , GPE and PERSON ( NORP ) had made any reference in their appeal to the fact that the previous judgment had not mentioned ORG either in its operative part or in its reasoning , or that it had declared their action null and void .
CARDINAL . The defendants lodged a further appeal on points of law , alleging that the parties to the sale had been in good faith , as provided by LAW no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in the operative part of a final decision , allowed the appeal by the opposing parties , varied the previous judgment in part and consequently dismissed the appeal introduced by the applicants against the first - instance judgment . In the reasoning part of the judgment the court relied on section CARDINAL LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL to find groundless the request to have the sale declared null and void , considering that at the time of the sale the then tenants had been in good faith and had not been aware of the “ invalidity of the [ ORG 's ] property title ” ( nevalabilitatea titlului de proprietate ) .
